revised_title: Debating the Efficacy of Sharp-Pointed Conductors in Preventing Electrical Explosions
tldr: This article discusses the debate surrounding the effectiveness of sharp-pointed conductors in preventing electrical explosions. The author, Dr. Musgrave, disagrees with the findings of Dr. Franklin and Mr. Nairne, arguing that the universality of sharp points in preventing electrical explosions is not proven. He explains that the explosion depends on the quantity of electric fluid accumulated and the type of conductor used, challenging the validity of some experiments conducted by Mr. Nairne.
